bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 173 (Friday, December 2, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. KAPTUR:H.R. 6430.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18:To make all Laws which shall be necessary and proper forcarrying into Execution the foregoing Powers, and all otherPowers vested by this Constitution in the Government of theUnited States, or in any Department or Officer thereof.[Page H7144]

item.title: Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act of 2015

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1576)

summary.text:
Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act

This bill directs the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)to assess and report on the cultural and historic resources in the waters of the Great Lakes.

NOAA must recommend in its report whether: (1) underwater geographic areas in the Great Lakes should be designated as national marine sanctuaries to protect resources of historical and archeological significance; and (2) the designation of a network of underwater Great Lakes areas that protect those resources could bring significant educational opportunities, economic development, jobs, and tourism to the Great Lakes region.

bill.title: Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act

item.title: Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act
To require the Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere to conduct an assessment of cultural and historic resources in the waters of the Great Lakes, and for other purposes.
Great Lakes Maritime Heritage Assessment Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Federal Lands.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
